meanings.definition: Wrinkled or contracted, especially due to lack of moisture.
meanings.sent1: The old apple was shrivelled and dry.
meanings.sent2: The raisins were shrivelled from being left out in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The shrivelled balloon made a funny squeaky noise when touched.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes of winning the race shrivelled as she fell behind.
meanings.sent5: The shrivelled leaves crunched underfoot as they walked through the forest.

meanings.definition: To become or make wrinkled or contracted.
meanings.sent1: The heat shrivelled the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She shrivelled the paper by crumpling it up.
meanings.sent3: The sun shrivelled the ice cream cone before she could finish it.
meanings.sent4: His confidence shrivelled as he faced the intimidating opponent.
meanings.sent5: The lack of water shrivelled the once lush plants in the greenhouse.
